alert.note: Alert for Summers; Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 5:49AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Alleghany County in west central Virginia, Greenbrier, Summers and Monroe Counties in southeastern West Virginia through 645 AM EDT... At 548 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bingham to Oakvale. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Alleghany... Lewisburg... White Sulphur Springs... Ronceverte... Rainelle... Alderson... and Rupert. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
